intro: Malouetia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan malouetia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
